code_repairing_0:
Light:
m_Lightmapping: 2

The above change will change the value of "m_Lightmapping" from 4 to 2, which will switch the lighting type from "real-time" to "baked". This will reduce the resource consumption for the static object using real-time lighting.

Light:
m_Lightmapping: Baked Lighting
'''

code_repairing_4:
The code snippet you provided is in YAML format, which is a text-based serialization format used to represent structured information in a portable and readable format. The code snippet describes a Unity scene file, which contains a light object with a "m_Lightmapping" property set to 4, indicating that it is using real-time lighting.

To fix the bug, you need to change the "m_Lightmapping" property to "baked lighting" by setting it to 1. Here is the updated code snippet:

'''
Light:
m_Lightmapping: 1
'''
This will fix the bug of resource consumption for static objects using real-time lighting, and the light object will now use baked lighting instead of real-time lighting.
